Entries.default:
"You the one causing trouble in Cotta's neighborhood?" 

The wolf at this man's side raises her hackles and growls. He shushes and pats her behind the ears, all the while keeping his focus trained on you.
"...so she asked him what he calls that trick, and he says 'the consuagli!'"
"Cotta recognizes a friend." He winks at you.
"Fair payment for a smooth transition." He tosses you a purse.
"Cotta's just making sure no one bothers our friend." He tips his head to indicate Zamar.
"You doing okay, Zamar?"
"Farewell."
[Attack] "How about I stitch your hide into sailcloth?"
"Don't you have a date with Zamar?"
"Weapons ready, bilge rats!"
"Zamar can keep Príncipi ships afloat." Cotta narrows his eyes.
"Tell the shipwright to accept Cotta's deal before he suffers another 'setback.'"
"Leave Zamar alone and I'll put in a good word with Furrante."
"Tell me my business again and I'll sew your wolf into a pair of boots, aimico."
"What's in it for me if I help broker an agreement between you and Zamar?"
"Cotta will see that his casità knows your name. There's also coin to spare."
"And Cotta will get you the Príncipi discount on Zamar's goods. Deal?"
"Sounds fair. I'll hammer out the details with Zamar."
[Attack] "Counter offer - I bring Zamar your head."
"Gellarde. Here's an advance. Go tell Zamar the good news. Cotta will handle the rest."
"Cotta wanted you to get Zamar in line, not spill his guts all over the dock!" He wipes a line of sweat off his brow.
"Any chance you're the one shaking down Zamar?"
"Zamar has money problems. Cotta has solutions. The little man doesn't know how to count his coins."
"Someone robbed Captain Radora. You have anything to do with that?"
"Depends. You seeking vengiatta for that souse?"

"Not Celezzia!" His hand goes to the scruff of his companion's neck. 

A chuckle rises from his mates, which they fight to suppress.
"Radora's coin, but she's too soused to miss it." Cotta chuckles to himself.
"This idiot's wolf has already peed on my good leg." Zamar glowers at Celezzia.
"Cotta heard a newcomer was talking with Zamar." His free hand moves toward the weapon slung on his belt.
"Cotta is done with you."
"Why are you shaking down Zamar?"
"Sientere. Cotta only plays nice with friends."
"Any thoughts, Serafen?"

"You've got to ask, cap? A Príncipi deal be the all round winner."

The orlan shrugs, running a furred hand over his braided beard.

"No one threatens Cotta, you overstuffed boil!" 

Celezzia lets out a low growl.
"Clussa's Voyage would be a mercy compared to what I have planned for you."
"You and your mangy friend have to sleep sometime."
"Better that you listen to the hairy piglet." Cotta nods, glancing from Serafen to you.
Cotta aims a horrified look from you back to his wolf. His cohorts trade uncertain murmurs.
Cotta flinches and turns to his crew. He studies each of their faces in turn.

"This one's not worth it."

Cotta whistles through his teeth. His crew abruptly lower their weapons and stand down.
"Just give me Captain Radora's money and I'll leave you alone."
"The coin is gone, aimico."
"Ale for Cotta's friends and food for Cotta's wolf. My casità gets the rest." He pats Celezzia's flank and smiles toward the rest of the gang.
"Out of Cotta's way."
"I changed my mind."
"You're letting go of a good deal." Cotta shrugs and tongues his upper teeth.
[Attack] "This one's for Radora."
"Celezzia, the throat!" Cotta releases his wolf and points at you. The rest of his mates take up their arms.
"Cotta will stay out of Zamar's shadow." He signals for his mates to stand down.
"You have any idea what this will cost Cotta's crew?" Grimacing, he draws his weapon and advances.
"There's better ways to scare him than threatening innocents."
"Eccosi, and whose side are you on - your casità or the wolf?" Cotta aims a bewildered look at Edér.
"What can I do for you?"
"To Cotta you return. Why?" He clicks his tongue to get his wolf's attention.
"Sorry, Vailian names all sound the same to me. Which one is the pretty wolf?"
"You'll know soon enough." Cotta bares his teeth, too, at Edér.

"Your smoke and mirror ghosts do not impress Celezzia, and they do not scare Cotta." 

A line of drool drips down between the wolf's bared teeth.
"I'm not here to cause trouble."
"Your Celezzia is about to lose a paw to my [Player Animal Companion]."
[Say nothing.]
"The silence is Cotta's favorite sound."
"[Player Name] finds them amusing, which is enough for [Player Name]."
"No? Smart, aimico."
"What do you want?" He tugs on his wolf's scruff and drags her back to his side.
Blinking, Cotta yanks Celezzia closer by the scruff of her neck. His lips pull back in a grimace.
"Cotta likes you already."
"You want something from Cotta?"
[Attack] "A taxidermied wolf is just what my quarters are missing."
"Nice wolf."
"Celezzia is Cotta's heart. She is his rage and his spirit." He pats her flank and smiles.
[Pull spirits from the In-Between.] "Smoke and mirrors? I think not."
Cotta's eyes snap open the instant that he grows aware of the many forms thronging you. The moment passes as you dispel them from view.
"Complanca! Cotta does not doubt his eyes."
"She owed money to Zamar. Money I need back."
"No. I just wanted to compliment your fine work."
Signaling to his mates, Cotta tightens his grip on his wolf's scruff.

"If Cotta did such a thing, he might extend gratitude."

He narrows his eyes, nodding.
[Attack] "Only cowards attack from behind."
"Cotta tires of seeing his family sailing derelict wrecks."
"You know the boss?" Cotta glances toward his mates.
"Then you know Furrante's got a dimple on his cheek. Which side's it on?" Cotta winks and opens his palms.
"Furrante's dimple is on the right side."
"The left side, as I recall."
"Trick question. He's got two dimples."
"Aye, right enough." Cotta blinks. His hand moves away from his weapon.
"Dead wrong, aimico."
"You're lying. Furrante doesn't have any dimples."
"Keep that hairy mouth shut." He points to Serafen.
Serafen smirks, head canting slightly. He mimes locking his scarred lips and tossing the key at Cotta's feet.
"I thought Remaro's pup kept better company." Cotta glances at Serafen.
"Ahoy friend. See you still be doing that whole referring-to-yourself-by-name thing. Would've thought it'd've cost you enough lays by now to be dropping that affectation."

"Wrong play, Cotta. Let's be keeping this the friendliest of friendly fucking chats, lest the captain be calling your raise."

His furred hands rest near his own weapons.
"Look, Celezzia - your supper comes with blue fur." He nudges the wolf, eliciting a deep growl.
"Really, captain? I hold my bird to a higher standard."
"That's a 'yes' if I ever heard one."
"I've seen prettier pets." Maia winks at Ishiza.
"Cotta's wolf pisses on your bird, aimica."
"Do any of you honestly think you can take me?"

"Zamar gets hisself steady work, the pirates know they're looked after, and you and me get to shove off from this mess with a Príncipi favor in our hold. Charting another course risks running us aground of everyone's bad side."
The blue orlan's left ear twitches slightly.
"Cotta has not missed the sound of your voice, Serafen."
